intro: Caruelina vauthieri, commonly known as the Vauthier's caruelina, is a rare and distinctive flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
